channel.title: Posts on Grant's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Grant's Website

item.title: MSI Windows Installer
item.description: MSI Files These are generally easy as 3.14. If the vendor has adhered to MS standards then it should just be a case of running the MSI with: MSIEXEC /i setup.msi /qn Parameter Meaning MSIEXEC is the install engine. /i means install. /qn means quiet, no dialogue. Try: run “msiexec” in cmd to see the options. Things get a little more complicated when vendors start adding custom dialogues to the setup process, e.

item.title: Finding Silent Parameters
item.description: If you don’t know what the setup file’s silent install switches are, there are a few ways to find out. (Also, you will want the silent/unattended uninstall commands too.) RT*M Check the vendor documentation. Sometimes they’ll provide the info needed to silently install their product. Even better if they actually provide step by step instructions on how to install via Config Manager! (But don’t get your hopes up…) Just Bing it!

item.title: Github Permissions
item.description: Error When trying to git clone or git push I would get the following error: git@github.com: Permission denied (public key). fatal: Could not read from remote repository. Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists. To fix this, you need github to trust the machine. On your machine, run: ssh-keygen Keep it simple by just pressing Enter, Enter, Enter. grunt@debian:~/dotfiles$ ssh-keygen Generating public/private rsa key pair.
